frame.audiotranscript: One of Ipsen’s existing products, Product X, has recently gained approval for a new indication following encouraging results from a phase 3 trial.

Prof Reynolds has calls James to invite him to present the results of the trial to his neurology team as he would like them to understand more about the efficacy and safety of Product X. Let’s hear their conversation.

James: Good Evening, James here.
Reynolds: Hi James, Prof Reynolds here. I’ve been reading about some encouraging results from the phase 3 trial for Product X. Would it be possible for you to make a presentation to my team of physicians and provide more information regarding this trial?
James: Yes, sure Prof Reynolds. Please let me know a suitable time and date next week.
Sam is a sales rep who has recently joined the Ipsen marketing team. Sam and James used to work together previously in a different company and are good friends. During a coffee break at work, James mentions to Sam that he has been invited by Prof Reynolds to make a presentation to his team. Let’s hear their conversation.
James: I’m meeting with Prof Reynolds and his team of physicians next week. He has invited me to present the data from our recent Phase 3 trial for Product X. I’m looking forward to talking to his team and answering any questions that they may have regarding the trial.
Sam: That’s great James! Now that you’ve mentioned this meeting, I was wondering if I could ask you a favour.
James: Sure Sam, go ahead.
Sam: As you know, my team is actively promoting the new indication for Product X. I was wondering if I could come with you to your meeting. You can introduce me to Prof Reynolds and his team, and I could then give them a short presentation on Product X. This will give me a chance to meet some of the physicians and promote our product.
